philosophy: Symbols are NEVER tied to specific plants. The symbol is everything. The legend defines meaning.
core_principles: A symbol is a VISUAL PATTERN, not a plant type
The same symbol can represent different plants on different blueprints
NEVER assume what a symbol represents without checking the legend
Focus on IDENTIFYING and DECOMPOSING the symbol accurately
The legend is the ONLY source of truth for symbol meaning
Your job: Recognize symbols. The legend's job: Define meaning.

layer_1_outline.description: The outer boundary shape of the symbol

layer_2_interior_pattern.description: What fills or decorates the inside of the symbol

segmented.description: Divided into pie-slice or wedge sections

layer_3_markers.description: Specific marks or indicators within the symbol

multiple_dots.description: Multiple dots indicating multi-stem or cluster

layer_4_modifiers.description: Additional characteristics that modify the base symbol

steps: 1. IDENTIFY the symbol using decomposition framework
2. LOCATE the legend on the blueprint
3. SCAN legend for matching symbol pattern
4. READ the label/description next to the matching symbol
5. THAT label is what this symbol represents ON THIS PLAN
6. NEVER assume - always verify against legend

when_no_legend.action: Flag as 'Symbol identified but meaning unknown - no legend available'

when_symbol_not_in_legend.action: Flag as 'Symbol not found in legend - may be custom or unlisted'
when_symbol_not_in_legend.provide: Complete decomposition and closest legend matches

training_examples_reframed.note: The 200 symbols from training materials are examples of VISUAL PATTERNS, not plant definitions
usage: Use to learn variety of outline shapes
Use to learn interior pattern types
DO NOT use to assume plant type mappings

the_200_symbols_teach.circular_variations: 50 examples of how circular outlines vary
the_200_symbols_teach.star_variations: 40 examples of how star/spiky outlines vary
the_200_symbols_teach.stippled_variations: 40 examples of how stippled patterns vary
the_200_symbols_teach.cloud_variations: 40 examples of how cloud outlines vary
the_200_symbols_teach.other_variations: 30 examples of shrub, grass, groundcover patterns

critical_rules: NEVER say 'This is a deciduous tree' - say 'This symbol has circular outline with radial interior'
NEVER assume meaning from shape alone
ALWAYS decompose into outline + interior + marker
ALWAYS reference the legend for meaning
ALWAYS provide composite_id for consistent matching
The symbol IS the data. The legend IS the dictionary.
